Cédric Beust ♔ wrote:
> 
> 
> On 9/24/06, j_cumps <j_cumps@... <mailto:j_cumps%40yahoo.com>> wrote:
>  >
>  > > Interesting. So you don't trust your test?
>  >
>  > I trust my tests. But I like to show other people what my tests did.
> 
> Logging can also be useful to make sure your tests do what you think they
> do.
> 
> On more than one occasion, I have written tests that passed because they...
> did nothing at all.

That's why every test I write has a fail() statement in it. My IDE takes 
care of that. Is there any other way you would have written a test with 
nothing in it, except be distracted/take a break after first writing the 
test method? I'm interested in the possibility of some other strange 
sequence of events leading to that.

Take care.
